TEXT: The applicant is a NORP national , born in DATE and living in the GPE area .
A.

In DATE a daughter , J. , was born to the applicant and PERSON In DATE the parents divorced . In DATE the applicant was awarded sole custody of J. During the court proceedings PERSON was occasionally placed in a children ’s home and with substitute parents , following the applicant ’s consent .

In DATE a second daughter , PERSON , was born to the applicant , the father being P. In DATE brought proceedings before ORG , seeking to obtain sole custody of A. The applicant also requested sole custody .

On DATE an official acting on behalf of ORG ( sosiaalilautakunta , socialnämnden ) placed both children in immediate public care in a children ’s home in pursuance of LAW of LAW ( lastensuojelulaki , barnskyddslag CARDINAL/CARDINAL as amended by Act CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) . The applicant had left the children on the premises of ORG , objecting to its processing of P. ’s action for sole custody of A. The applicant had told PERSON she no longer had the strength to care for the children and that they “ no longer had a mother ” . After the incident the applicant could not be reached . DATE she had telephoned a social welfare official to say she had “ bid farewell to her children ” and “ had stopped being a mother ” .

By decisions of DATE ORG , in pursuance of LAW of LAW , maintained the public care of the children after having heard the applicant and the respective fathers . The applicant had opposed the public care . On DATE the GPE and ORG ( lääninoikeus , länsrätten ) heard the applicant , a social welfare official , the applicant ’s psychologist and a nurse of the children ’s home . In its decisions of CARDINAL DATE ORG upheld the care orders , essentially considering that the applicant ’s uncontrolled and unforeseeable behaviour had seriously jeopardised the children ’s health and development . Although the applicant had previously availed herself of support measures for herself and the children , she was no longer willing to co - operate with the social welfare officials , being of the opinion that there was no need for such measures . The applicant appealed to ORG ( korkein hallinto - oikeus , högsta förvaltningsdomstolen ) . On DATE , however , she withdrew her appeals , considering that the she could not expect an impartial examination thereof . On DATE the cases were struck out .

For the follow - up of its care orders ORG , on DATE , requested ORG to disclose information of significance to the applicant ’s children ’s growth and development . The request was made pursuant to LAW of LAW ( sosiaalihuoltolaki , socialvårdslag CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) .

On DATE ORG refused the applicant ’s request for the appointment of a guardian ad litem for herself and her children . The applicant had argued that a guardian was needed to protect them “ against the arbitrary acts of ORG ” until the custody proceedings had come to an end . The applicant ’s extraordinary appeal was rejected by ORG ( hovioikeus , hovrätten ; “ the ORG ” ) on DATE . Her extraordinary appeal to ORG ( korkein oikeus , högsta domstolen ) was rejected on DATE .

On DATE ORG , at ORG request , appointed a guardian ad litem for PERSON for the purposes of the custody proceedings . The applicant ’s appeal was rejected by ORG on DATE . Leave to appeal was refused by ORG on DATE .

On DATE ORG granted P. sole custody of PERSON applicant had not requested access to A. in the event of her not being awarded sole custody . Her request for an order regarding access arrangements solely between her CARDINAL daughters was refused as not being based on law . The applicant ’s appeal was refused by ORG on DATE after a re - hearing . On DATE she was refused leave to appeal to ORG .

On DATE P. requested that the public care of A. be revoked . On CARDINAL DATE ORG considered that although the original grounds for the public care of A. were no longer at hand , its termination at that moment would run counter to the child ’s best interest . ORG decided to revert to the matter within DATE but allowed the public care to be implemented in P. ’s home . On DATE ORG declined to examine the applicant ’s various petitions in which she objected , inter alia , to the implementation of the public care in P. ’s home . The applicant ’s respective appeals were rejected by ORG on DATE . Her extraordinary appeals were rejected on DATE .

On DATE an official of ORG refused to disclose to the applicant an assessment of ORG ’s parental abilities which she had requested for the purpose of the pending custody and public care proceedings concerning NORP The refusal was upheld by ORG on DATE . On DATE ORG quashed the ORG ’s decision , referred the matter back to ORG and directed it to disclose the assessment to the applicant . On DATE P. ’s appeal was rejected by ORG .

On DATE ORG terminated the public care of A. pursuant to LAW . ORG noted that P. had now been awarded sole custody of ORG and had assumed and organised her care in an adequate manner . The applicant appealed , requesting that she and PERSON immediately be reunited or , in the alternative , that the public care be continued but implemented in her home until she had again been awarded custody of her children . The applicant ’s appeal was rejected by ORG on DATE and her further appeal was rejected by ORG on DATE .

On DATE an official of ORG authorised the implementation of J. ’s public care in PERSON ’s home in GPE , where he had founded a new family . On DATE ORG decided to maintain the public care of J. but directed that she should continue to live with the father PERSON The applicant had requested that the public care be terminated and that J. be returned to her . Her appeal was rejected by ORG on DATE .

On DATE the ORG rejected the applicant ’s application to have PERSON returned to GPE in accordance with LAW on the Civil Aspects of International Child Abduction . ORG noted , inter alia , that J. had not been removed from GPE in contravention of LAW , given ORG competence to order the implementation of her public care in GPE . On DATE ORG rejected the applicant ’s appeal . ORG and the administrative courts declined to examine the applicant ’s requests and appeals related to ORG ’s placement in PERSON ’s home in GPE .

On DATE filed a civil action seeking sole custody of J. The applicant opposed the action but stated , on DATE , that she would not participate in the further proceedings , considering that ORG would not be independent and impartial in the case . On DATE ORG , without holding an oral hearing , awarded PERSON custody of J. , as the applicant could no longer be considered opposed to the action . On the applicant ’s appeal ORG on DATE returned the case to ORG , directing it to hold an oral hearing and to ascertain the child ’s best interest in the matter . The applicant was refused leave to appeal to ORG on DATE . In the ensuing proceedings before ORG stated that the applicant had consistently declined to attend meetings whereby her current conditions for assuming custody of J. could be assessed . In its fresh decision of DATE ORG again awarded PERSON sole custody of J. , considering , inter alia , the opinions of ORG and the social welfare authorities in GPE .

On DATE ORG refused various requests made by the applicant , inter alia to the effect that J. be returned to GPE , where the applicant should be entitled to see her every night and weekend . The applicant appealed , requesting , inter alia , that the results of a lie detector test of the judges and referendary of ORG be attached to its decision . On DATE the applicant ’s appeals were rejected except in so far as her access request had been refused . As this refusal had amounted to an access restriction , ORG was directed to issue a formal decision to this end . The applicant ’s further appeals were rejected by ORG on DATE .

On DATE ORG refused the applicant ’s request for access to J. but granted the applicant the right to visit J. in the children ’s home in GPE CARDINAL times a year when PERSON would visit GPE at the ORG ’s expense . No restriction was issued in respect of correspondence and telephone calls . The applicant ’s appeal was rejected by ORG on DATE . The said court noted that since J. was living in GPE the access as requested by the applicant could not be implemented already for practical reasons and would in any case manifestly jeopardise the child ’s development and safety . On DATE ORG declined to examine the applicant ’s further appeal as no such appeal was allowed . The applicant was invited to meet PERSON in DATE but did not show up .
On DATE ORG revoked the public care of PERSON applicant ’s appeal was rejected by ORG on DATE . Her further appeal was rejected by ORG on DATE .

In decisions of CARDINAL , DATE and DATE ORG of GPE declined to bring charges against ORG or any official of ORG or ORG . In contrast with the applicant ’s accusations the Prosecutor found no evidence showing that PERSON or any of the officials had committed a criminal offence during their involvement in the applicant ’s matters . Moreover , ORG had certified not having received any written request for disclosure of the applicant ’s medical records . Moreover , any such request would have had to include the applicant ’s consent .

On DATE ORG ( lääninhallitus , länsstyrelsen ) found that the Deputy Chief Physician of ORG had failed to ensure , in response to ORG request of DATE , that only relevant parts of the applicant ’s care records were disclosed to ORG .
In decisions of CARDINAL and DATE ORG , for want of evidence , declined to bring charges against the lawyer of ORG or A. ’s guardian ad litem , whom the applicant had accused of offences in office .

On DATE the Deputy Chancellor of ORG ( apulaisoikeuskansleri , justitiekanslersadjointen ) found no grounds for taking action against any of the judges whom the applicant had accused of offences in office .
On DATE the applicant gave birth to a third child , whose father has apparently not been identified . It appears that the applicant and this child continue to live together .
B. Relevant domestic law
CARDINAL . Access to documents

Section CARDINAL of LAW provides for the right of a social welfare client and the client ’s guardian to obtain information concerning the client . According to LAW ) , a social welfare client shall have access to documented information and other data which relate to the matter concerned and are in the possession of social welfare personnel or ORG .

The Act on Publicity of Official Documents ( laki yleisten asiakirjain julkisuudesta , lag om allmänna handlingars offentlighet CARDINAL ) stipulates that even information in a non - public document shall be disclosed to an applicant , appellant or other person whose interest , right or obligation the matter concerns , if the information may influence or may have influenced the consideration of the case ( Section CARDINAL ( CARDINAL ) ) .

In accordance with LAW of LAW social welfare authorities are entitled to obtain the necessary information from other authorities in the performance of their work , without prejudice to the obligation of confidentiality .
CARDINAL . Remedies against public officials

According to LAW ( rikoslaki , strafflag DATE ) , a civil servant who , by intent or neglect or carelessness , acts or omits to act in breach of his or her professional duties as provided for in statute or regulation is liable to punishment , if the act or omission is not insignificant , having regard to the damage caused and other circumstances ( chapter CARDINAL , sections CARDINAL ) . In accordance with LAW of the Social Welfare Act public officials and members of , for instance , a municipal board must maintain secrecy in respect of information of a confidential nature which has been disclosed to them for the performance of their duties . Various provisions in LAW may become applicable if this obligation of secrecy is not respected ( LAW of LAW ) .

Under LAW ( Suomen Hallitusmuoto , ORG ) anyone whose rights have been infringed and who has suffered damage as a result of an illegal act , or by the negligence of a civil servant , is entitled to prosecute the civil servant , or demand that he or she be prosecuted , and to claim damages ( Article CARDINAL ) . Under LAW ( vahingonkorvauslaki , skadeståndslag CARDINAL ) proceedings may also be brought against the ORG in respect of damage resulting from fault or neglect by its employees in the performance of their duties ( chapters CARDINAL and DATE ) .
